website_summaries.verdict: An accurate, easy-to-use thermometer for deep-frying that can also be used for many other things.
pros: This infrared thermometer is super easy to use – just point at the oil you're using to get an accurate digital temperature readout
The LCD is backlit so it's easy to read and the auto-off function helps save the battery
Can also be used for other cooking temperatures or to read the temperature on almost anything
cons: If you use this frequently, it will go through batteries quickly

customer_reviews.title: Defective product...
customer_reviews.text: Not very happy with this, ordered a dual pack of these inferred temperature guns. You can clearly see that the on the left is over 200o and the one on the right is most likely the correct temp.
customer_reviews.author: Battboyy

customer_reviews.title: Does it work? Nope!
customer_reviews.text: I pulled the unit from the package, connected the battery, and pointed the laser at my wood bar. The temperature was 90 deg F? The house was 68 deg F and the bar was cool to the touch. I proceeded to check other objects with a similar outcome. I then went into the kitchen where I had a pan of boiling pasta sauce, it read 210 deg F. Therefore, I’m not sure if it works or not? This product is junk. It’s 65 deg f I’m my house; leather chair reads 92, wall 96, speaker that is off 95, metal leg of chair 95. Enough said. I’m returning for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: RLG63

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: First, it says on the packaging that the 9V battery is inside. There was even tab to pull out, but no battery. After I've bought and put a new battery inside, the meter didn't work. Laser and display are workings, but meter shows the same number no matter what I point it at. Can be anything from 40 to 300 degrees, displays 70.9. Unfortunately, I took it with me overseas, so I can't return it... waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Tomasz W Bugajski

customer_reviews.title: Works well with some reservations.
customer_reviews.text: Great gadget to tell surface temperature and monitor hot and cooler areas on cooking surfaces. Not sure how well it is calibrated. Seems a bit off when aimed at boiling water that should be 100C or 212F at sea level and standard pressure. Smooth rubber finish may not be durable. Had many devices with this coating and eventually it becomes sticky and can't be cleaned. Let's see how long this one lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor T.

customer_reviews.title: I would like a refund
customer_reviews.text: Does not work, the changing of unit temperature doesn’t work, I have tried to put it in Fahrenheit and it doesn’t do it . Also trying to turn on the laser does not work. Also the unit doesn’t turn off . So everything is mess up . I would like a refund .
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Feliz

customer_reviews.title: This thermometer worked very well for about 7 months, ...
customer_reviews.text: *****UPDATE***** The manufacturer contacted me and sent me a new one, free of charge! I am up and soaping again with a now-functional temp device. Thanks Etekcity! Their customer support rep was very helpful in getting this resolved. Original review: This thermometer worked very well for about 7 months, then over a period of a few weeks, it started showing temps much higher than it should. All the way up to 124F for something at room temp in winter in CA. I'm going to have to contact the company since I bought it less than 1 year ago. Hopefully they will make this right.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Necessity for sous vide cooking
customer_reviews.text: Prior to this purchase, I would just guess a hot temperature to sear foods in after sous vide cooking. This always resulted in smoking oil (which loses nutritional values and leaves a bitter taste). When I tried this out I first tested the accuracy by measuring the water bath temperature shown in the picture, then I was able to adjust the heat on my cast iron grill pan until it was just barely below the smoke point of the oil I used. No smoking oil and a much better sear. For only $15 this is a no brainer for sous vide.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Slater

customer_reviews.title: Very inaccurate! Useless product.
customer_reviews.text: This thermometer is absolutely inaccurate! It shows my body temperature is 33°C; boiled water is 70°C; my melted sugar is 108°C which should be way higher. It totally ruined my baking! Very disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: czr

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate at lower temps
customer_reviews.text: Device reads accurate room temperature; however, it reads approximately 6-10 degrees lower than actual temperatures while measuring colder (outside) temperatures. This after hundreds of comparisons inside and out using 3 different digital thermometers all averaged with weather.com reports for my area (all other devices read air temperatures and were within 3 degrees of each other). I chose high emissivity targets and various surface densities at the recommended distance with more than double surface area needed.
customer_reviews.author: carol ray

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this product 2 days ago. As soon a ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product 2 days ago. As soon a I pressed the trigger I started getting error codes AH and Al high low without a accurate reading on anything. Can anyone tell me what does this mean?
customer_reviews.author: Angela Myers

customer_reviews.title: Cant seem to calibrate to correct temperature reading
customer_reviews.text: Brand new out from packaging. My friend got theirs and reads normally around 70s-80s. I tested this during my class working with chocolate and I'm short bout 40 degrees from all my readings. The sole reason of buying this was to work with chocolate tempering/ganache. I'll be shipping this back asap in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Striker124

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work properly
customer_reviews.text: Accuracy of item always 2 to 3゚ less then one of regular thermometer. When I have mine taken every day in an assisted living Facility and I'd try it right afterwards with this item and it's maybe up to 7" off.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Boerner

customer_reviews.title: NOT ACCURATE for TAKING BODY TEMPERATURE for COVID-19 MEASURING
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these for family and friends to use to take body temperature readings to monitor whether friends, family or visitors have a fever because of concern over the COVID-19 VIRUS. My forehead or throat readings always come out around 94 degrees. The same with the others. Now I find out that these have a 'broader range" style laser which makes them incapable of taking an accurate human body temperature. This is listed as an AMAZON #1 BEST SELLER and I have to think people are buying them because of COVID-19 and NOT to cook a steak! If you want to take body temperature better find another unit with a narrower range.
customer_reviews.author: Practical Guy

customer_reviews.title: Use This Product for Perfect Chocolate Every Time!
customer_reviews.text: We use these infrared thermometers in our chocolate shop when tempering chocolate. This is THE way to go if you're doing anything similar. Forget the hand thermometer, which is still a guessing game half the time. Chocolate has to be perfectly in temper to look beautiful, and we count on this product to make sure we're right at the correct degrees. We've used them for many years and we'll keep using them! Julie, Owner, The Chocolate Therapist
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only as useful as your imagination.
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these and that isn't nearly enough. You kind of need them all over the house. We have used them to do cooking with solar ovens. Test temps EVERYWHERE in the house, so you know where you have air leaks. It can be used as a poor mans thermal imager. I have hear of others using it to find electrical faults by finding wires with increased temps. They go on sale often though and are on lightning deals near xmas.
customer_reviews.author: wanna beco

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price by any standard!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic tool for the price! I bought this originally to pinpoint problems with my central AC system and found it to be very useful when adjusting the dampeners in my duct work. I was also pleasantly surprised that it helped me locate several un-insulated spots in the framing of my house. Accuracy seemed very good for my usage and comparing it another digital probe I trust, it yielded the same results usually within less than a degree of difference. My cats also find the laser fun to chase around! I currently own several more Etekcity electronic items including a pair of headphones, gaming mouse, multimeter, and digital scale, all of which work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Adam S. Guida

customer_reviews.title: Works Great and Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I had my package stolen for the first time and as soon as I let amazon know they shipped me a new one for free! It really makes me feel secure knowing that if something happens that's out of my control I'm not out the money. I bought this to make it easier to accurately keep track the temperature in my reptiles enclosures and to make it easier to tell if my frozen thawed mice are at the optimal temperature to feed. It does both of these fantastically as well as the added bonus of being fun to point at random objects to see what their temperature is. 10/10 would recomend!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need it to.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this thermometer to check the temps of my liquids and oils for making soaps. Gone are the days of putting an old fashioned stick thermometer in and waiting to see what the temperatures are. I love being able to just zap them with my new temp gun and see the numbers immediately!! This is the first of its type that I've ever used and I've zapped almost everything that could possible have a temperature difference in my home. This is a fun, yet very helpful and, I'd say necessary gadget for those who don't like to wait for a surface temp reading on anything!! Highly recommend for all my soap making friends.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana G.

customer_reviews.title: Remarkably good quality and useful
customer_reviews.text: This is a surprisingly good unit considering the low price. It appears to be accurate within a degree or so over a wide range of temperatures and surfaces. Although it is intended as an industrial tool, I have found it very useful for cooking, checking the refrigerator, looking for heat leaks around the house and automotive work. Well worth having around the house.
customer_reviews.author: M. H. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Fun, easy tool for surface temps. Stick to internal thermometers for cooking meats!
customer_reviews.text: Fairly accurate thermometer, perfect for surface temps, not so much for cooking meat though. I bought this Etekcity Lasergrip 774 Non-contact Digital Laser Infrared Thermometer Temperature Gun with hopes it would allow me to ditch using internal read thermometers. When it comes to cooking any meat, but especially chicken, I want the thermometer to be very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua & Nicole Conley

customer_reviews.title: Batteries were definitely NOT included...
customer_reviews.text: If you purchase this, purchase batteries too. Don't trust that they'll include the battery like they say they do. Description says 1 battery included. Mine did not come with a battery. Yes...I checked in the gun as well. No battery. So that was a little annoying because I really needed to use this product this morning. This morning was the reason I purchased it in the first place. I'll update product function review after I get some batteries and use it. But for right now it gets 1 star and only because you have to atleast give a 1 star to post a review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've been buying from AMAZON for last 3 years & have not loved an item as much as this one!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised! I needed this to test the water temperature in my in-ground pool (the pool's vaccumm sweeper kept sucking-up my thermometer, or it would get sucked-in by the skimmer). Well, with this thing you point at the water and gives you an exact reading! I also used it to test temp in all my rooms where I believe our A/C is not working and it works precisely. Also, when taking out my Dog (who has very sensitive paws), I test the concrete outdoors (one time it read 133 degrees ....wow too hot, so I postponed our walk until the sun went down!)
customer_reviews.author: bam

customer_reviews.title: Works Well, exactly as stated
customer_reviews.text: I use this to take temp readings when I am roasting coffee. It is highly accurate and simple to use. The auto turn off feature keeps batteries fresh. I nice option I should have ordered is the slightly more expensive model that projects the circle showing area for actual temperature measurement. On my model there is a laser dot projected but the size of area that is "seen" and measured by the IR sensor grows as the distance increases. The Etekcity Lasergrip 1025D, projects the laser dot but a second laser projects a circle that shows measurement area. Makes it clear exactly what you are meaasuring. I use it around the house as well.
customer_reviews.author: Its_Dave

customer_reviews.title: Seems accurate and consistent but laser dot is far off center
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, great price. Use mainly for curiosity and to check temp change on AC units (supply vs return should be 15-20 degrees). Seems accurate to me, can't be sure about that but is very consistent when returning to the same spot. I took off 2 stars for a major flaw in my book- the laser dot that tells you where you're aiming is WAY off. Shooting to a 9ft ceiling it (about 3ft from unit) the dot is like 6 inches from center. So tall ceiling shooting at a small return etc... very difficult- must line it up by eye. Not having a (usable) aiming dot makes it much harder to use.
customer_reviews.author: Third Shift

customer_reviews.title: You had one job to do...
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this no stars, I would. The whole purpose is to measure temperature. But no. This one is at least 7-8 degrees (F) lower than it should be. (Yes we checked.) So in a time when we absolutely need to know whether a player is showing signs of covid, this “thermometer” is measuring low. Total waste of money. No wonder there was such a good deal on them.
customer_reviews.author: Aigean

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted a week
customer_reviews.text: After the first week started getting codes "Hi" or "Ah" - I'm assuming these were some kind of "hold" functions as the display would lock in at a certain temperature. This wouldn't be the end of the world, but these messages continue to display, with no apparent reason, instead of showing the temperature. When the temperature finally did display, it would be wildly inaccurate - my skin temperature is apparently 122F and a light bulb socket was ~650F. Very frustrating product to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun and useful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to test my apartment air conditioning. It won't measure the air temperature coming out of the vents, but it gives accurate readings of the metal inside the vent so I can easily tell when the a/c isn't putting out cool air. The vents are in the ceiling and I'm only 5 foot 1 but I only have to point the laser at the vent from below to get a good reading. Easy to use, easy to see the readings. It's also quite amusing to point it at other objects in the room just for the fun of it, and the batteries are holding up well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy F

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy!
customer_reviews.text: We use this almost on a daily basis in our saltwater aquarium store for a quick reference of water temperature. Although the unit can be +/- a degree it gives us a quick reference to verify waters. Also great for around the house. I've used to check AC registers to see if cooler air was coming out, testing grill temp, and even the bonfire to see how hot it was!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Pay more attention to the positive reviews
customer_reviews.text: I was on the fence about this thermometer because I read many of the negative reviews stating that the accuracy was not great or that people were getting different readings from the same object with this thermometer. I have been using this product for several weeks now on a pretty regular basis and have not had any of the issues mentioned in other reviews. I am using it to measure the temperature of the hubs and tires on my boat trailer. I have found that holding it 6-8 inches away from what I am trying to measure gives me the best results.
customer_reviews.author: prachnis

customer_reviews.title: Accurate for our temps in Bearded Dragon cage
customer_reviews.text: We got a bearded dragon over Christmas for my son and upon doing tons and tons of research, I became quite informed on how crucial the temps and lighting is in their enclosures. We got a digital thermometer which was great but I liked the accuracy and mobility of having the temp gun to check the different areas. It works very nicely and seems to me on point with a quick reading. It was inexpensive too so that is a plus
customer_reviews.author: MakeupartistJen22

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun for the entire family!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to find out how hot a cast iron pan would get on both stovetop and grill and to see how rapidly the heat dropped, etc. This being the outbreak of the corona virus, I decided to scan all my family members forheads as the came through the front door. Everybody came through fine, with our cat, Fruitcake being the finest of us all with a reading of 72 degrees F. My son and daughter began competing to find the coldest thing possible. My daughter's best was the freezer, whereas my son recorded -42 F (pointed it at the moon). What a wonderful tool for learning the sourcery that surrounds us!
customer_reviews.author: Tannhauser

customer_reviews.title: Temps not right. Fake thermometer.
customer_reviews.text: Tested on a bare forehead with no occlusions like smoke, makeup, grease, et al. Temperature shows a range of 88F - 91F. Same subject in room temperature environment for at least 5 hours. And subject is not yet dead. This is a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Great for reptile terrariums
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient thermometer gun for reptile terrariums and even aquariums. It is very accurate and always within 1 degrees Fahrenheit of the exact temperature. The light up screen also makes for easy reading of temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Debi Boucher

customer_reviews.title: It works.  And I use it for some odd things. :)
customer_reviews.text: It's fun going around the house taking the temperature of everything. It was useful for verifying our HVAC was working or when troubleshooting some electronics. I also use it verify oven and stove temps when cooking. I want to make sure I'm not going to burn my food. I got to get that pan at exactly 375 degrees F or else the potatoes won't fry perfectly. It's Just so convenient to get a temperatures of things very quickly without touching them.
customer_reviews.author: TGD

customer_reviews.title: Have had this for several years and still works great--even after a dunking!
customer_reviews.text: Don't try this at home but I accidentally dropped this digital thermometer into a tub of hot water (we monitor the bath water temperature so not we don't get scalded.) After being fully submerged for several seconds, the display flickered and disappeared. I dried the unit as best I could and put it in front of a fan for the day. It didn't look promising but by the evening with a fresh battery installed, the thermometer worked as if it had never been dunked. I would by another in a heartbeat. There are many other uses that you will find once you own it. Reasonably priced, well made and it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Van Schaick

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Terrific
customer_reviews.text: This thermometer is outstanding, nice size --smaller version and very dainty and can fit in a drawer when not in use. I use it for baking bread to ensure bread temperatures throughout the cooking process and to determine which selves in my refrigerator is the correct temperature to store specific temperature items or long term proof bread. The best one I have had so far and certainly the most accurate. Thanks P.S They were out of this item when so I had to wait several weeks, but let me tell you it was DEFINITELY worth the wait.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Doll

customer_reviews.title: It works and is a fun toy for adults
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this for a day so I can't rate it's longevity but ease of use and accuracy is up there. I now know the temps of everything in my fridge and freezer and my hands vs my feet vs my forehead vs my hubs skin. I shot everything with this bad boy. Super fun. Oh and it worked well whilst making soap, which is what I bought it for. So bravo! 5 stars. Fine family fun.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: If you're not sure if you need a lazer thermometer, you probably do
customer_reviews.text: I use this for making mash, candles, and soap. It is definitely precise and seems pretty accurate. It's a lot of fun and way better than a metal thermometer in so many ways. The instant reading is its best feature. If you think you may want one of these, you totally do. Just buy it. So worth it...
customer_reviews.author: Ozzy

customer_reviews.title: Works great, so fun!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fun. I pointed it at everything: the stove, the oven, the radiator, the faucet, the windows, the cat... it was correct within a couple of degrees and helped me figure out that my oven sucks at keeping its temperature (but the cat does not). For the price, you can't beat this product, and I guarantee if you buy it you'll find a million things you suddenly need to know the temperature of.
customer_reviews.author: Heather E.

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy in question
customer_reviews.text: This product has been more fun than useful. I question the accuracy of the temperature, seems like it consistently measures the temperatures hotter than they are - like 13 to 17 degrees hotter (so more than just a little wrong). It's fun to hand to the kids and use as a learning tool to record temperatures of different objects around the house.
customer_reviews.author: JaymeB

customer_reviews.title: Is there a big, hot thing you need to measure?
customer_reviews.text: Then this tool is for you. Does what it says on the tin, point it at the hot, sweaty thing and hold the trigger for a continuously updated reading. Let go of the trigger to freeze the last recorded temp. There's a button to turn off the backlight, one to turn off the aiming laser (yes, it's only for aiming so you can turn it off if you're aiming at a car hood or whatever), and one to switch between C/F degrees. Simple, effective, satisfying measurer of hot, steamy...things. Well, cold things too, but they don't make good ennuendo.
customer_reviews.author: Henchmen4Hire

customer_reviews.title: broken
customer_reviews.text: pulled it out and it was broken. I started the return process and COVID happened... it is sitting in the package ready to ship back but the place I needed to take it is closed UGH
customer_reviews.author: Jaymee

customer_reviews.title: Accurate to within a few degrees
customer_reviews.text: I like how simple this is, point and shoot and you get your temperature reading. I use it to measure temperatures on boat engines and to measure ambient temps in my garage over the winter. It won't measure the air per se, but you can measure the temp of an object to get a good idea of what it's at. Comes with a battery and has served me well over the last year. Who knew it would come in handy too with the pandemic!
customer_reviews.author: Shayne Dwyer

customer_reviews.title: Scan everything!
customer_reviews.text: Ac vents, engine blocks, summer asphalt, cookies and more. This thermometer is great for fast, accurate readings. I used it to locate an Ac problem in my home blowing warmer than usual and it worked flawlessly. It has a wide variety of uses and is a must for any tool box or kitchen drawer.
customer_reviews.author: RH

customer_reviews.title: A MUST!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had got this about a year ago have not had to change the batteries yet it works very accurately, I actually use it for making hard candy like suckers and other baking products. I’m not fond of the mercury thermometers or candy thermometer. so I got this to try it out I will never go back to a candy thermometer this is very accurate . This is the number one tool to have in your pantry drawer.
customer_reviews.author: mom2jav

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to the tool box. Having a long difficult problem with a 95 dodge dakota truck shutting down while driving. Using this tool I was able to find the normal temp range of the electrical relays. I was able to identify a temperature spike that shut down my truck. At that time I was able to identity my electric fan had an internal short that tripped the auto shut down relay killing my truck after it was warm. Without this tool none of that would have been possible except a dead truck and question mark?. Success, myself, where 3 mechanics and a so called auto electrician had failed. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: David Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Take the photo off your product’s page.
customer_reviews.text: Rather deceptive advertising. Yes it is written in at least 3 locations that it is not suitable for human temperature taking. Why is there a deceptively INACCURATE photo showing someone taking a child’s temperature? Hence the 1 Star (even though it probably is referring to the “Accuracy “ of the device’s +\- temp accuracy). Shame shame.
customer_reviews.author: bobfp

customer_reviews.title: Not for human
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a body temperature and when I needed to use it, it showed wrong Temperature. 92? Forehead. So I read the manual and it says not for human and animal. But I have a picture of it when I bought says for human. I tried to return it but I couldn’t. Over 30 days. So a word of advise , no matter what you buy, open and test it immediately. I am just surprised why amazon let this company change the description.
customer_reviews.author: Goli

customer_reviews.title: Works well balancing hydronic heat system
customer_reviews.text: I have only had it a few weeks but it works well and seems very accurate. When I point it at different indoor digital thermometers it agrees within 0.5F. It gives inaccurate readings if you point it at reflective surfaces such as copper piping. I found I have to put several strips of masking tape over the copper pipe to get a good reading. I would say that for the price it is incredible technology
customer_reviews.author: Crody

customer_reviews.title: Great value tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to check the temperature of the lake where I swim, and it works great. In leaving it around the kitchen, I see my kids checking temperature of all sorts of things around the house, prompting their curiosity in science. All that said, it gets the most use as a cat toy, with the kids getting the cat to chase the laser around the floor and up the walls. The cat also gives the product five stars.
customer_reviews.author: CHERI R.

customer_reviews.title: great for 15 bucks
customer_reviews.text: I'm in a position where I have to spot check temperatures for food service safety. This thing does a pretty dang good job of it for 15 bucks. I happened to be in a location with a health inspector one day a month or so ago, and this thing hit within .1 degrees of what his machine was measuring across the board. It blew my mind. Just note that these thermometers cannot read internal temperatures. I only have to verify that sliced meats and vegetables are at the correct temperature. It is great for that!
customer_reviews.author: Donnie Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Laser quit working after about 5 measurements. I was ...
customer_reviews.text: Laser quit working after about 5 measurements. I was excited to get this item. I wanted to use it on my smoker to help calibrate my thermometer and find places I might be losing heat. Well, when I was first testing it by aiming at random things in my fridge and around the house the laser stoped working. Im not sure if it reads well or not. I have no way to positively aim it anymore. I am sending it back. Update: I was contacted by Etekcity and they resolved the laser issue I was having. Hate to admit it but it was a button I must’ve accidentally pushed. All I had to do is push it again...
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: The cats love it too!
customer_reviews.text: I love this, originally got it to keep track of my snake's habitat and food temp and have been using it for farrrr too many things. The laser 'sight' on it, is well calibrated and my cats flippin' love it. I love how accurate it's been (we tested it) and how long the battery life lasts. The light up screen is a super huge plus and I can't rave about this enough. Warning though: you will act like a giant child testing temps on everything that doesn't need checked.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent thermometer for reptile keepers.
customer_reviews.text: Got this to measure temps in my reptile enclosures. Its quick and accurate. No more waiting minutes for the probe thermometers to adjust. To get the most accurate reading, I suggest pointing it up close to the area you want to measure. Pointing from afar will give you and inaccurate reading. Also, dont point through glass as it will just measure the temp of the glass and not actually what's behind.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Not functional except as toy for cat/dog.
customer_reviews.text: Functional only as a cat/dog toy for chasing the red dot. Completely unable to read temperatures. My hand is 131 degrees! My carpet is 145 degrees! Tried everything - put in new batteries (other than supplied). Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for grilling
customer_reviews.text: I needed a thermometer for multiple uses, and needed something that can measure accurately the heat of my grill. Although it has a spot thermometer, I found there are areas which get hotter and will literally burn the meats. I know exactly how hot the grill actually gets and where the sweet spot can be found on my old-fashioned fire red gas grill. In the process I have also been able to gauge the accuracy of this thermometer by measuring the temperature of boiling water. I only wish I would have bought the higher temperature limit unit, since I do plan to eventually do some re-tempering of steel blades, where accurate temperatures are key to a good temper.
customer_reviews.author: J. G. Smerda

customer_reviews.title: For the price this cannot be beat
customer_reviews.text: I've come to use this almost daily all around the house. The accuracy is outstanding for the price. Battery consumption is outstanding. In my extended use, I've only consumed one battery, and am on the second after a couple years of use. I would buy this again in a heartbeat if/when the time comes. NOTE: Common things I use this for.. Monitoring temps for oven, stove top, grilling, smoking meat, testing temps on interior walls and windows.
customer_reviews.author: RedR

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use while tempering chocolate and it has worked quite well. I am under the impression that since it only gives you surface readings, there may be a slight degree variation of about 2 to 4 degrees, so if you need to be really specific, checking with a second one that actually goes into what you are measuring might be the best option at first, and once you have a good idea of the possible degree difference you are good to go. (that's how we did it in pastry school and there was a 4° difference)
customer_reviews.author: Plath27

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Effective to Use!
customer_reviews.text: The griddle pictured is the primary purpose I had in mind when I purchased the unit. The laser makes it super easy to tell where you're pointing the gauge, and the backlight feature makes it easy to read even in dimmer lighting. The griddle has cooled in the picture, but I am easily able to regulate and balance the heat by quickly checking different parts of my griddle before I start cooking. So now, even though there may be a few hot spots, I can tell where they are and use them to my advantage! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: biplane Pilot

customer_reviews.title: Great way to take temperature and decent accuracy
customer_reviews.text: I use this around the house in many ways daily! I originally purchased this for my fish room for measuring aquarium temperature. But I use it to take temperature outside, on food, and even AC/Heat vents. It's so easy to use as well, just point the red laser and let go. Accuracy is also plenty accurate for what I use it for. Excellent pricing as well. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: James Duong

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: The battery (included) were a little difficult to put in. You have the option to turn off the red sensor light. All you have to do is hold the button and point where you'd like a reading. You can choose between celcius or farenheit. You can also turn on or off the blue light on the screen, which comes in handy at night time. I really love that I can get accurate readings all over my ball pythons cage and not be restricted to where my thermometers are placed in his enclosure.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Great product, even greater company.
customer_reviews.text: We use this at work daily to check pool temps. It works well and is very easy to use. After about a year and a half it stopped working and I got an error message on the screen. I was going to just buy a new one but I thought I would reach out to Etekcity and see if there was a way to salvage it. They responded to email almost immediately and when I wasn't able to clear the error message they informed me it was still within their 2 year warranty and they sent out a new one right away. Couldn't be more impressed with the customer service.
customer_reviews.author: MSpike

customer_reviews.title: Best gadget I've bought in years.
customer_reviews.text: What a cool gadget. Accurate! Love this thing. I can now get a quick and precise temperature reading in my Aquarium. It has so many other uses though. I can now eliminate my inaccurate cheap digital thermometers i bought for my 120 gallon aquarium and feel more comfortable about my finned friends safety and comfort. Honestly I think every household should have one of these. It is a great little fun tool that is as easy as pulling a trigger.
customer_reviews.author: Jonny J.

customer_reviews.title: Thermometer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I'm old and I'm already sick and didn't want to catch the virus and one of the first things they say to watch for is a low-grade fever. So because I'm sick I get sick easy and I check my temperature often this is a great way to do it I've also checked my cats chicken that I was cooking my husband it's been interesting
customer_reviews.author: linda huston

customer_reviews.title: Ambient device temperature affects reading
customer_reviews.text: I had this stored in my hot truck. When I took it straight out to use, it was showing 10 degrees hotter than the temperatures I was actually recording. It 30min to cool off in my home at 76 degrees before it finally started giving an accurate reading. The reading was dead on after the device had time to cool down to rooms temperature. I had this same experience with another cheap thermocouple as well. Seems to happen frequently with the design
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: NOT accurate at higher temps
customer_reviews.text: I have used the bout 6 times on my grill, reads way to high 600-700 degrees. NO WAY !! It seems to work on low temps like hot water in my Sous Vide container. But I purchased it for my grill and iron skillets. Skillet temps were way off also 550 to 600 degrees just after a minute or two on a high burner. Wish I could return it. Don't recommend it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Alan D. Vetterick

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my bearded dragon, but i end up using it all of the time! It seems pretty accurate, I don't know how i would tell if it isn't. i can easily check food temp, and my bearded dragon temp! Easy to use, just point and shoot!
customer_reviews.author: Molly K Skelton

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I have so many animals with so many different and unique climate needs. This works for the water surface temp of my fish tank, the bedding for my snake, the heat inside my chicken coup and brooder, etc. I’ll never need a thermometer again! Very practical, and kinda fun. I’m glad I needed this lol, because it’s worth it for more than just my original need!!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Know what it can and cant do!
customer_reviews.text: As a professional cook; I know to look for things like oil shimmering, or smoking. This tells me the variances in temperatures across my pan's surface (like a flour test), and tells me my tri-ply pans are worth more than cast iron or carbon steel (at the same price). I can read the temperature of a room instantly with it. For cooking; I'd prefer my Javelin 4 sec thermometer, but this is a great toy / learning equip / instant read of surface temp.
customer_reviews.author: matt benedict

customer_reviews.title: Do not get for food temps
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to help with cooking like the description stated but it does not work for that. You have to have an internal thermometer to get safe and accurate readings. This device is good for temperatures for rooms and to see if AC ducks are working properly. It’s good for surface temps only but not on food.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's great. I'd definitely recommend it for pet owners, parents, and generally curious people.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my reptile, amphibian, and feeder insect enclosures and it works beautifully for that. It's so much better than having to rely on a stationary digital or dial gauge. I actually find myself using it all the time now on random things like the temperature of my toddlers bath water, how hot the water in my house actually gets (way too hot-it was around 135°), the temp of the concrete outside, of various rooms in the house, the stove top, the oven door....I use it all the time on just about everything for both safety reasons and just out of pure curiosity. I wish I would have known that this existed years ago. It's incredibly convenient.
customer_reviews.author: The Murray Family

customer_reviews.title: Measures temps consistently, I think update added
customer_reviews.text: Good price and like the 9 volt battery. Since the temps I am measuring are higher than that of boiling water I have no idea of how accurate it is but if it is consistent than it does what I need. Some have asked if you can use this to take your temperature? No, as the air temp affects your skin temperature and that is what you will be measuring. I tried this today in an effort to answer this one for people
customer_reviews.author: Jay M.

customer_reviews.title: Mistakenly purchased this Thermometer but found it useful
customer_reviews.text: I was shopping for a thermometer for measure body temperature and found this product. Because in title, it show "human" and made me think it is for body temperature. After receiving the product, I realized it's for surface. But I did not return this product thinking I can use it to measure food temperature and freezer..etc other uses.
customer_reviews.author: Lhk

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, compact, and fun to use.
customer_reviews.text: I use this laser thermometer to read the surface temperature inside my ball python's enclosure. Mine gives accurate readings almost instantly without any issues. The thermometer comes with a battery to use and an auto shut off feature when not in use. I also use the laser pointer as a toy for my cat to chase around sometimes. Care should still be taken to make sure to not point the laser at any eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much Needed in Your Soap Arsenal
customer_reviews.text: This thermometer is a much needed tool for one's soap making arsenal. Soapers, it will save you time, money and lots of frustration. Prior to buying it, I was using meat thermometers, which died quickly or all together would just stop working on me--presumably due to being constantly submerged in liquids and oils? Either way, I wasted lots of money, time and energy complaining about and actually replacing thermometers. Coming across this thermometer has been a soap saver. It's much cheaper on Amazon than other vendors who sell comparable laser infrared thermometers. It's easy to use, durable and appears to have a lengthy battery life. A great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Sherreida

customer_reviews.title: Glad now it says NOT FOR HUMANS
customer_reviews.text: I got this thermometer around a month ago, like most people, because of all the COVID situation. I read some reviews and I thought it was a good product, unfortunately it does not work at all! Now it is clarified in the product description that IS NOT FOR HUMANS, but when I got it wasn’t that way. It is not accurate at all, it a perfectly normal and healthy person it shown 90 °F that’s hypothermia! Overall the readings does not make any sense, it’s a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Perla Karina Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great gizmo
customer_reviews.text: Needed to measure temps on computer equipment. Can't get to the gear or the AC ducts to take the temp (Why do they place those duct 8' up a wall and I'm only 5' tall.) Anyway this thing works great. Point towards what you want to measure, pull the trigger, keep the red dot on your subject, and bang, you got it. Use it for all kinds of stuff now. Easy to use and it works .... Sorry Moms, you can't take the kids temp with it, doesn't work on biologics.
customer_reviews.author: Rdys

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and very accurate.
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive, but very easy to use, and apparently very accurate. I am a measurement freak, and I love to zap corners with this. 1) I have found in our 24th floor Chicago condo that the floor of our bedroom closet measures 38 degrees in winter(!). After insulating an using a curtain, our bedroom is quite comfortable. 2) Directly across the hall from us is the transformer room. It puts out 96 deg air from its door vent. In the winter, I allow it to come in around our front door, but in summer, I use weather stripping to keep it cooler. Good tool. Very interesting to play with.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Whaley

customer_reviews.title: Useful for AC check, radiant window heat, and pans before cooking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this initially just to check the window and AC temperature to figure out if my AC was doing it’s job and how much heat I was getting from the outside. My wife now uses this to check the temperature of the pan before starting her cooking sessions so that she can get a better sense of the heat she is cooking with. Who knew? :)
customer_reviews.author: Ty Chau

customer_reviews.title: first unit very inaccurate, the replacement OK
customer_reviews.text: This is basically a toy. It measures the temperature of various (not reflective) objects in my room at 65 while the temperature inside is about 73. The first time I tried it, it drifted and started showing 72-73 degrees but then went back to 65. The red "dot" is actually a small bar. I am returning it. Edit: I got a replacement from Amazon. The new unit is much better, what I would expect for the price. I am adding two stars.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got an Infrared Thermometer
customer_reviews.text: I got this right when my electric kettle broke and I use to have several temperature settings on that. I like when my hot water is about 175 degrees F, hot but not boiling. It was really convenient to have this laser thermometer to point at my pot on the stove. I wouldn't use this to judge internal temperatures like of steak or chicken but I've used it to compare if my oven is at the temperature it says it is. I check multiple spots. So far, it's often at or around the same temperature. So anecdotally that's accurate. I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MelodyM

customer_reviews.title: Love it, for non practical use
customer_reviews.text: Do I really need a digital laser thermometer?? Well, no...but it’s really cool... and sometimes I just wanna know how hot or cold something is...just because If I leave it out in plain sight, any friends or family sees it and does the same... Measure the foood in the microwave Or the Driveway on a hot summer day Or an ice cream cone Or the tv screen Keeps kids of all ages amused for hours Yes, there’s a serious use for these...but not in my house. Screen is easy to read, point and shoot usage. No complaints
customer_reviews.author: Linda A.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect Compared side by side with my fluke at work.. same readings as fluke 63.. A $300 gun
customer_reviews.author: Monty Tyler

customer_reviews.title: This is really GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for the lab and it works great - quite acceptable accuracy and oh so convenient. It is also a lot of fun. So much so that I bought a second one for my house - make the perfect cup of coffee, see what temperature the sky is (you will be surprised), your girlfriends forehead, or whatever ... It is really a lot of fun and useful too.
customer_reviews.author: Steve SB

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Color me impressed. Although I have not checked the calibration of this device, it works great and the case design is fantastic. I see no sharp edges or casing marks/degating on the case, no residue or dust from cheap manufacturing facilities like you would get with harbor fright and knockoff devices. I am using it to spot check my house for drafts and insulation problems. Works great for taking sweeping, constant measurements. Backlight is very bright and easy to read. It gets my vote.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser245334

customer_reviews.title: Smoker
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the guy to use with the smoker. Calibrated it and tested it with other thermometers. It's off by about 8 degrees, but that's not bad. After getting the temp for everything around, he used it for the smoker. The brisket and sausage were delicious! Wood smoked, no gas!
customer_reviews.author: SE

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool for a very nice price
customer_reviews.text: Item came as expected works as expected. The only issue I have is it reach 2 degrees different than actual temperature. Not a big deal many other of the more expensive ones do the same thing. Keep in mind the price I could not be anywhere else I will live with the 2-degree difference. Just check it when you get it and make a mental note or Market on the side of the thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: A fun tool, a useful toy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic toy. I mean tool. No, I mean toy. I got it to spot check the temperatures in my gecko's enclosure, but I didn't stop there. You can use it for whatever reason you first bought it, but you will also use it to find out the temperatures of everything that you can measure. Coffee. Light bulb. A/C vents. Is it warmer on this side of the room? Is your cat's surface temperature warmer than yours? This satisfies that same impulse you get when you've got a new drill and want to put holes in absolutely every surface around you, but it's 100% less destructive. It's good at figuring out how warm the gecko is, too.
customer_reviews.author: JM Wright

customer_reviews.title: Battery closure lid opens spontaneously but it works
customer_reviews.text: The build quality suffers due to a battery closure lid that won't stay closed, even though I have tamped down the battery and connector as much as possible. I taped the lid closed. But the unit measures temperature well. I checked it against two other thermometers and the difference was 1 Fahrenheit degree.
customer_reviews.author: Sonoma Geezer

customer_reviews.title: Great thermometer for the price
customer_reviews.text: Accuracy is lacking for this thermometer unless you get it specifically 1-2 feet away from the target. Other than that it is a great tool for an unbeatable price.
customer_reviews.author: Review Robot

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and helpful and NOT FOR HUMANS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: There isn’t anything I didn’t like about this product. It’s accurate and I used it to test surface temps for my reptiles terrarium, which absolutely have to be accurate. I recommend these to everyone I know who has reptiles, but unfortunately lately since Covid has been a problem, they haven’t been available at all because people actually thought these temp guns worked for reading a human’s forehead temp...UUUHH, YEAH NO!! THESE ARE NOT MEDICAL GRADE TEMP GUNS!!!! Seriously people!!
customer_reviews.author: Disneyfam

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for its purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for its purpose. I use this to check the surface temperature outside before we walk our woofie. Did you know that at 125 degrees, you dog will burn its feet on the pavement / sidewalk? So I use this for our sanity check before taking the little guy out walking. This afternoon the walkway was 136. Exposed aggregate is quite a bit hotter than concrete. Asphalt is even hotter. Direct sun is the culprit, so I check carefully in Spring and Summer months to be sure we aren't cooking our little buddy.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Harris

customer_reviews.title: Best toy I’ve ever bought my husband
customer_reviews.text: I had to buy if for my husband because he wouldn’t give back the one he borrowed from the neighbor. He happily measured the temperature of everything he could point it at. It became annoying after a few hours, and I had to take it away from him. Also makes an excellent cat and/or dog toy and is great for children who are trapped in the house and have nothing else to do.
customer_reviews.author: Sparkles

customer_reviews.title: Really fun to use, and accurate
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after seeing someone measure the temperature of their cat's fur in the sun on reddit. I wanted to see how hot my dog gets when he lays in the sun so I bought it. It has been the best $15 I've spent in years. It's so much fun measuring the temperatures of everything. Like how cold is my beer? How hot are my tires after a long trip? How cold are my wife's feet when she says "my feet are so cold. You, too, can answer those questions and more if you have one of these. One day I'll use it for a real reason, but that day is far away.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: slower response, fall a part from a 3 feet drop.
customer_reviews.text: and not sure if the measure is accurate. it show 2 degree difference from my previous one. Quantity definitely needs improvement. My other one (cost the same), a different brand taken beat and still hold up after few years. This one in first week got its display cover fall off from a small drop.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works for Chandlers
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to measure the temperature of my wax during candle and wax melt making. Before this I was using a different thermometer that was not accurate and I knew this because of the way my wax would dry. After using this thermometer I have gotten smooth tops every time and no sinkhole in the candle/wax melts. This would make your life so much easier especially when wick testing and you have to measure the outside temp of the vessel.
customer_reviews.author: Ednita Tavarez

customer_reviews.title: Good but not the most accurate
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to read the temp of the water in my fish tank during water changes. Its great in general, exactly what it claims to be. My only frustration is that its not the most accurate. My tank is kept at 76 F and this thermometer reads it at 79-80 F. It does say in its manual that it is accurate within about 3 degrees, so that goes along with my findings. Not perfect, but WAY better than holding a meat thermometer under the tap like I used to have to do!
customer_reviews.author: Erik M Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Infrared Temperature Gun
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this gun for use with my handcrafted soap business. As soon as I assembled the battery it worked like a charm. It's user friendly and I'm not a "gadget gal" lol! I will purchase from this vendor again should the need arise! Great product, timely shipping and good price!
customer_reviews.author: Wah

customer_reviews.title: You need this
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a year now and I'm obsessed with it (something my husband loves to pick on me about... he thinks I may need a support group). I use it constantly to find hot spots and cold spots in the house. We've made some changes to the HVAC, our insulation, and sealed up leaks behind our baseboards, all of which has improved our energy efficiency and saved us money. And it's all thanks to this handy thermometer. Plus, it's just really, really fun to point a laser at things.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Absolutuly love it!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is GREAT! I love it and was so worth the $10 or so that I paid for it. I use this product everyday and have used it for over a month with no issues. I use it to monitor my Snake cages and it is so simple to use and is spot on or at least within a degree or two at the most but who knows when you are dealing with that small of a difference it could be anything to cause that difference. If you want something that will give you a really good idea of what a temperature is this is your product.
customer_reviews.author: D. T. Whitesall

product_meta.title: Etekcity Infrared Thermometer 774 (Not for Human) Temperature Gun Non-Contact Digital Laser Thermometer-58℉ to 716℉ (-50 to 380℃), Standard Size, Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackNOTE1. The measuring surface is about 2 cm below the infrared aiming point. 2. For best accuracy, the distance between the thermometer and object of measurement should approximately be 14. 17inches (36 cm). Etekcity Laser grip 774 Thermometer guns have been used by major airports and security offices during the 2014 Ebola outbreak. Laser Guided Aim with precision at whatever you wish to measure, thanks to the laser beam guidance feature. Even from a far distance, the laser provides a mark to ensure accuracy every time you make a measurement. Infrared Lens The Infrared lens inside the Laser grip 774 Thermometer provides temperature readings without the need to touch or come close to anything dangerously hot or cold. You'll be able to effortlessly measure high temperatures, hazardous and inaccessible objects, and even moving targets; such as hot engine parts, cooking surfaces, swimming pools, bath water, wine coolers, hot asphalt, electric bearings, and much more. Specifications Temperature Range: -50℃ ～ 380℃ (-58℉ ～ 716℉ )Accuracy: 2% or 2℃ Distance Spot Ratio: 12: 1Emissivity Adjustable: 0. 95(fixed)Response Time and Wavelength: Package Included 1 x Etekcity Non-Contact Infrared Thermometer1 x 9-Volt Battery1 x User's Manual.
feature_bullets: Better accuracy: The distance to spot ratio is 12: 1, meaning the laser grip 774 can accurately measure targets at greater distances compared to most other Thermometers; for best accuracy, the distance between the thermometer and object of measurement should approximately be 14. 17 inches (36cm)

Target quicker: measure surface temperature ranging from -58℉ to 716℉/ -50℃ to 380℃, you can choose the unit from ℉/ ℃; response time: ≤500Ms; a built in laser gives you the precision to hone in on the exact space you want to measure

Added functions: the LCD screen is backlit, also has an auto-off function to extend the battery life, and features a low battery indicator so you never accidentally run out of juice (battery included). Storage Temperature: -20-50℃ (-4-122℉). Operating Temperature-0-50℃ (50-122℉)

Versatile design: infrared technology makes this thermometer handy to measure the surface temperature of various objects especially temperatures above boiling points and below freezing points; use it when you are cooking and barbequing, performing auto maintenance, doing home repairs, and a host of other tasks

Note: the thermometer can't measure the internal temperature of an object; temperature readings from this devices are inanimate objects, the measured temperature for humans or animals will not be correct; FDA, FCC, CE compliant; class 2 laser, optical power 0. 5-0. 9Mw

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars15,857 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
